judges: C.HARI SHANKAR O R D E R (O R A L) % 17.02.2023 C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022 1.
metadata.court_name: HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI
key_issues: Registration of a trademark under the Trade Marks Act, 1999, and its potential infringement by a similar mark in a different class.
Validity of a trademark registration and its potential cancellation due to non-use or other grounds under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999.
Rectification of the register of trademarks to remove an allegedly infringing mark, as sought by the plaintiff in this case.
Opposition to a trademark registration and the process for withdrawing such opposition, as seen in Opposition No. 917190.
Deletion of a trademark from the Register of Trademarks and the binding effect of a court order in this regard.
Classes of goods and services under the Trade Marks Act, 1999, and the potential for confusion between similar marks in different classes.
Proprietary rights of a trademark owner and the remedies available to them in case of infringement or passing off.
The role of the Registrar of Trade Marks in maintaining the register of trademarks and deciding on applications for registration, opposition, and rectification.
The binding effect of a court order on parties to a trademark dispute, including the obligation to withdraw opposition and not press certain claims.
Procedure for disposing of a petition under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999, and the court's power to allow or dismiss such a petition.
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary: Laboratoires Expanscience vs. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd & Anr.**

**Background:**
The case involves a petition under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999, filed by Laboratoires Expanscience (the plaintiff) against Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd & Anr. (the defendants) in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi. The plaintiff is the proprietor of the registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 3, which covers non-medicated lotion and cream for skin care, and has been registered since August 23, 1971, with a validity period up to August 23, 2026.

**Legal Issues:**
The plaintiff is aggrieved by the registration of the word mark "MUSTELA" in favor of the defendant in Class 5, which covers medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations, with effect from October 1, 2007. The plaintiff seeks rectification of the register of trademarks by removing the defendant's registration (No. 1607095) and deletion of the mark from the Registrar of Trade Marks.

**Arguments:**
The defendant's counsel, Mr. Manish Singhal, submitted that his client is willing to give up the word mark "MUSTELA" and agrees to its deletion from the Registrar of Trade Marks. Additionally, the defendant had instituted Opposition No. 917190 on January 18, 2018, before the Registrar of Trade Marks, opposing the plaintiff's registered word mark "MUSTELA". The defendant's counsel assured that his client would apply for withdrawal of the opposition and would not press it further.

**Court Findings:**
The court recorded the submissions of the defendant's counsel and directed the respondent to move an application before the Registrar for withdrawal of Opposition No. 917190 within three weeks. The Registrar was directed to take a decision on the application within one week.

**Decision:**
The court allowed the petition in the aforementioned terms, directing that the impugned word mark "MUSTELA", as registered in favor of the defendant in Class 5 (vide Registration No. 1607095), shall stand deleted and removed from the Register of Trademarks. The Register of Trademarks shall be rectified accordingly. The petition was disposed of, and the order was directed to be uploaded on the court's website within 24 hours.

**Key Takeaways:**

1. The plaintiff's registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 3 remains valid.
2. The defendant's registration of the word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 5 is deleted.
3. The defendant withdraws its opposition to the plaintiff's registered word mark "MUSTELA".
4. The Register of Trademarks is rectified to reflect the deletion of the defendant's registration.

The case highlights the importance of trademark protection and the court's role in resolving disputes related to trademark registration and opposition.

The plaintiff is the proprietor of the registered word mark 
“MUSTELA” in Class 3, in respect of “non-medicated lotion and cream 
for the care of the skin”. The said word mark “MUSTELA” stands 
registered in favour of the plaintiff with effect from 23rd August 1971 and 
is valid up to 23rd August 2026.

The plaintiff is aggrieved by the registration of the word mark 
“MUSTELA” in favour of the defendant in Class 5, for medicinal and 
pharmaceutical preparations. Registration of the impugned mark was

granted to the defendant on 31st March 2009 with effect from 1st October 
2007. 
 
4. 
The petition, therefore, seeks rectification of the register of the 
trademarks by removal, therefrom, of the Registration No. 1607095 
whereby the word mark “MUSTELA” has been registered in favour of 
the defendant. 
 
5. 
Mr. Manish Singhal, learned Counsel for the respondent submits, 
on instructions, that his client is willing to give up the word mark 
“MUSTELA” and is agreeable to deletion of the mark from Registrar of 
Trade Marks and rectification of the Register, accordingly. 
 
6. 
Mr. Rahul, learned Counsel for the petitioner submits that the 
respondent has also instituted Opposition No. 917190 on 18th January 
2018 before the Registrar of Trade Marks, opposing the plaintiff’s 
registered word mark “MUSTELA”. Mr. Manish Singhal, learned 
Counsel for the respondent submits, on instructions, that his client would 
be applying for withdrawal of the said Opposition No. 917190 and would 
not be pressing the opposition. The submission is recorded.  
 
7. 
The respondent is directed to move an application before the 
learned Registrar for withdrawal of Opposition No. 917190 positively 
within a period of three weeks from today.  The learned Registrar is 
directed to take a decision on the application within one week thereof. 
 
8. 
In view thereof, nothing survives for adjudication in the present 
Digitally Signed
By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI
Signing Date:20.02.2023
12:59:57
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 3 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001175 
 C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022                                                                            Page 3 of 3  
 
   
petition. It stands disposed of by recording the submissions of Mr. 
Manish Singhal by which the defendant shall remain bound. 
 
9. 
Accordingly, the impugned word mark “MUSTELA”, as 
registered in favour of the defendant in Class 5 vide Registration No. 
1607095 shall stand deleted and removed from the Register of 
Trademarks. The Register of Trademarks shall stand rectified 
accordingly. 
 
10. 
The petition is allowed in the aforesaid terms. 
 
11. 
Order to be uploaded on the website of this Court within 24 hours.

tree_structure.title: Case Header and Parties
tree_structure.summary:
According to the PDF document "Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd.," a legal case is ongoing in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi. The case involves a petition under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999, filed by Laboratories Expanscience (the plaintiff) against Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd & Anr. (the defendants).

The plaintiff is the proprietor of the registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 3, which covers non-medicated lotion and cream for skin care, with a registration date of August 23, 1971, and validity up to August 23, 2026. The plaintiff is challenging the registration of the same word mark "MUSTELA" in favor of the defendant in Class 5, which covers medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations.

The case is being heard by Hon'ble Mr. Justice C. Hari Shankar, with the plaintiff represented by Mr. Rahul Beruar, Adv., and the defendant represented by Mr. Manish Singhal, Adv. The court order was issued on February 17, 2023. The document also mentions an application (I.A. 21088/2022) related to the case.

The key facts and dates in the case are:

* Case number: C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022
* Neutral Citation Number: 2023/DHC/001175
* Registration date of the plaintiff's mark: August 23, 1971
* Validity of the plaintiff's mark: up to August 23, 2026
* Court order date: February 17, 2023

Source: Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd. PDF document.

tree_structure.title: Facts and Arguments
tree_structure.summary:
According to the PDF document "Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd.," a legal proceeding was initiated in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi (C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022 & I.A. 21088/2022). The plaintiff, Laboratoires Expanscience, was represented by Mr. Rahul Beruar, while the defendants, Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd & ANR, were represented by Mr. Manish Singhal.

The case involved a trademark dispute over the word mark "MUSTELA," which was registered in favor of the defendant on March 31, 2009, with effect from October 1, 2007. The plaintiff sought rectification of the register of trademarks by removing the defendant's registration.

During the proceedings, the defendant agreed to give up the word mark "MUSTELA" and to delete it from the Registrar of Trade Marks. The defendant also agreed to withdraw an opposition (No. 917190) filed on January 18, 2018, against the plaintiff's registered word mark "MUSTELA."

The court directed the respondent to apply for withdrawal of the opposition within three weeks, and the Registrar was directed to make a decision within one week thereafter. As a result, the case was resolved, and nothing remained for adjudication. The decision was digitally signed by Sunil Singh Negi on February 20, 2023. (Source: Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd..pdf, Page 1-3)

tree_structure.title: Decision and Orders
tree_structure.summary:
According to the PDF document "Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd.," a legal proceeding was held in the High Court of Delhi at New Delhi, with case number C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022. The plaintiff, Laboratoires Expanscience, was represented by Mr. Rahul Beruar, while the defendant, Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd, was represented by Mr. Manish Singhal.

The court decision, dated February 17, 2023, stated that the defendant's registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 5, with Registration No. 1607095, shall be deleted and removed from the Register of Trademarks. The Register of Trademarks will be rectified accordingly. The petition was allowed in these terms.

The document does not mention any specific arguments or facts presented during the proceedings. However, it notes that the defendant's submissions, as recorded by Mr. Manish Singhal, will be binding. The order was to be uploaded on the court's website within 24 hours. The decision was made by Judge C. Hari Shankar.

The PDF document, "Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd.," provides the details of the court proceedings, including the parties involved, their representatives, and the outcome of the case. The Neutral Citation Number for this case is 2023/DHC/001175. The digitally signed document was signed by Sunil Singh Negi on February 20, 2023.
